document.full_text: the british parliament forced america's president to stop for applause just once during his address in london on wednesday, after he referred to himself as "the grandson of a kenyan who served as a cook in the british army."
document.title: the lede: obama's reference to kenyan roots draws applause in britain
lines_and_colors: the british parliament forced america's president to stop for applause just once during his address in london on wednesday, after he referred to himself as "the grandson of a kenyan who served as a cook in the british army."
